text_paragraphs: Information Note on the Court’s case-law No.
Moreira de Azevedo v. Portugal (just satisfaction) - 11296/84
Claim for just satisfaction by an applicant whom the Court had held to be victim of a breach of Article 6 § 1 of the Convention

[This summary is extracted from the Court’s official reports (Series A or Reports of Judgments and Decisions). Its formatting and structure may therefore differ from the Case-Law Information Note summaries.]
Excessive length of criminal proceedings must have caused applicant pecuniary damage and definitely caused him non-pecuniary damage – sum awarded.
Reimbursement of amount claimed, less sum paid as legal aid.
Conclusion: Respondent State to pay the applicant specified sums (unanimously).
